messages.title: Opportunity for all children & young adults
messages.content: Providing 15 hours of free early years education to two years old.

messages.title: Making Gadebridge Park a great place to go
messages.content: Steve Wilson sat on the creaky benches of Gadebridge Park...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaign promises include providing £92 million to local schools, implementing policies to have record numbers applying for university and getting free school meals to save parents over £400.
The candidate promises to fight for a healthier way of life through promoting free school meals and fighting against NHS privatization.
Rabi Martins, as a human rights campaigner and retired business executive, fights against discrimination to bring together communities.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Result from the last general election shows 1st Conservatives; 2nd Liberal Democrats; 3rd Labour; 5th UKIP.

issues.education: The leaflet discusses providing £92 million to local schools, having record numbers apply for university, and offering free school meals which can save parents over £400.
issues.environment: The leaflet mentions making Gadebridge Park a great place to go.
issues.governance: Rabi Martins fights against discrimination and works to bring together communities, showing his stance on governance.
issues.health: Rabi Martins opposes NHS privatization and promotes healthy free school meals as part of his health policy.

politicalExperience.role: Human rights campaigner and retired business executive
politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting against discrimination and bringing together communities.

contactInformation.address: Return To Hemel Hempstead Lib Dems, 39 Neptune Drive, HP2 5ER

endorsements.endorsement: Vote for Rabi Martins to be your next MP.

quotes.text: Don't forget the elections on Thursday 7th May.

images.caption: Photo of Rabi Martins and his team.
Photo of Steve Wilson at Gadebridge Park.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is delivered by volunteers and paid for by donations.
